intro: Cytinus hypocistis f. solaris, commonly known as the sun blushing cress, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the Cytisaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red, fleshy, inflated pods that resemble small lanterns, which are unique among its relatives. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils, often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it blooms in late summer to early autumn. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
